page.title: 03Farming in Much Marcle
page.content: In Much Marcle there is quite a lot of flat land but in places it is quite hilly.Most of the land is very fertile and supports crops such as rape,wheat,barley,oats,beans,peas and tayberries. There is good pasture land for rearing dairy and beef cattle plus sheep. The farmers use a lot of sprays to keep the weeds out of the fields, and fertilisers to increase crop yield.Most of the farmers use tractors and modern implements and combine harvesters. The farmers are very busy from Spring until Autumn with the different crops ripening at different times.The quiet time of the year is Winter. Farming has changed very much over the years. Nowadays we use tractors instead of horses and we grow different varieties of crop. Finally we spray the crops more.
